algos.vanilla_classifier package¶

Submodules¶

algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier module¶

Vanilla classifier This is based on Carsten’s demo_machine Features: [np.mean(data), np.std(data), np.var(data)] Classification algorithm: Random forests

algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier.computeFeatureVectors(data)¶
algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier.deploy_model(rasterFile, modelFile, outputfile, winX, winY, stepX, stepY)¶
algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier.extract_aoi_data(polygonFile, imagery_type)¶

Extracts pixels for each polygon in polygonFile and returns them as masked numpy arrays. polygonFile is a GeoJSON which follows the specification in the README of the repo. imagery_type is the type of imagery used by the classifier

algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier.main(job)¶

Runs the vanilla classifier pipeline. job is a dictionary. For the format of job.json look in the README of this repository.

algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier.sliding_window_detector(rasterFile, classifier, winX, winY, stepX, stepY)¶
algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier.tfRasterToProj(x, y, geoTransform)¶

Converts coordinates from raster pixel to projected coordinate system

algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier.train_model(polygonFile, imagery_type, classifierFile)¶

Compute feature vector for each polygon in polygonFile, train random forest classifier and output classifier params in pickle file. imagery_type is the type of imagery used by the classifier

algos.vanilla_classifier.vanilla_classifier.writeResults(features, outputfile)¶

Module contents¶
